intro: Anil exstipulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed anil, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy leaves and small, pea-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The plant is native to parts of Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, leguminous pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Anil exstipulata is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
